claim: French Toast can hypothetically kill a Lannister.

supporting.text: Lannisters are fictional characters from 'Game of Thrones' and cannot interact with real-world objects like French Toast.

attacks.text: Lannisters are fictional characters from 'Game of Thrones' and cannot interact with real-world objects like French Toast.
Fictional characters can interact with real-world objects in crossover stories or alternate universes.
Crossover stories are non-canonical and do not reflect the original fictional universe's rules.
Fan fiction and unofficial works often blend fictional and real-world elements, creating scenarios where such interactions are possible.

supporting.text: French Toast is a food item with no agency or capability to harm any entity, fictional or otherwise.

attacks.text: French Toast is a food item with no agency or capability to harm any entity, fictional or otherwise.
French Toast could be used as a weapon if thrown with enough force, potentially harming even a fictional character like a Lannister.
Lannisters are fictional characters from a medieval fantasy setting, making the scenario of French Toast harming them purely speculative.
In extreme hypothetical scenarios, any object (including food) could be weaponized under specific conditions, though this is highly unlikely.

supporting.text: The laws of physics and biology prevent inanimate objects like French Toast from affecting fictional beings.

attacks.text: The laws of physics and biology prevent inanimate objects like French Toast from affecting fictional beings.
Fictional universes often bend or break real-world physics and biology, making the argument irrelevant.
Even in fictional universes, inanimate objects like food typically do not have agency or lethal capabilities unless explicitly stated.
French Toast could be enchanted or weaponized in a fictional context, bypassing real-world limitations.
There is no canonical evidence that French Toast has been weaponized or enchanted in the Lannister universe.

supporting.text: There is no established mechanism by which French Toast could exert lethal force on a Lannister or any other fictional character.

attacks.text: There is no established mechanism by which French Toast could exert lethal force on a Lannister or any other fictional character.
French Toast could be used as a projectile or blunt weapon if thrown with sufficient force.
French Toast lacks the structural integrity to maintain form when thrown at high speeds, making it ineffective as a projectile.
French Toast could contain toxic ingredients if prepared improperly, potentially poisoning a Lannister.
Lannisters are fictional characters from a medieval setting and thus immune to modern foodborne toxins.
